user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of setup_epoll_fd:
```c
static int
setup_epoll_fd (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  int fd;

#ifndef HAVE_MESSAGES
  (void) daemon; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */

#ifdef USE_EPOLL_CREATE1
  fd = epoll_create1 (EPOLL_CLOEXEC);
#else  /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  fd = epoll_create (MAX_EVENTS);
#endif /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  if (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == fd)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Call to epoll_create1 failed: %s\n"),
              MHD_socket_last_strerr_ ());
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }
#if ! defined(USE_EPOLL_CREATE1)
  if (! MHD_socket_noninheritable_ (fd))
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to set noninheritable mode on epoll FD.\n"));
#endif
  }
#endif /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  return fd;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to set noninheritable mode on epoll FD.\n"));
explanation: Only the parameter 'daemon' is a pointer in this function; it is declared as 'struct MHD_Daemon *daemon' and is used (or explicitly unused) in the shown fragments. There are no other pointer variables or pointer-returning expressions in the function (fd is an int, calls to epoll_create/epoll_create1 return int, macro usages do not introduce pointer variables here). Therefore only the declaration and uses of the 'daemon' parameter need investigation for compliance with Rule 8.13 (i.e., whether it should be a pointer to a const-qualified type). No other fragments in this function contain pointers that would be relevant to Rule 8.13.
